name: Weikuan Yu
content: Weikuan Yu Weikuan Yu Professor and Chair Department of Computer Science Office: 259 James Love Bldg. Mail: 1017 Academic Way, 253 Bldg. LOV, Dept. of Computer Science, Tallahassee, FL 32306-4530 Tel: +1 (850) 644-5442; Fax: +1 (850) 644-0058 Email: wyu3 @ FSU dot EDU | Research Team | Publications | Recent Grants | Services | About Weikuan (Will) Yu is a full professor and the department chair in the Computer Science Department at Florida State University (FSU). He has founded the Computer Architecture and SysTems Research Laboratory (CASTL) at FSU. Yu has broad research interests spanning computer architecture and systems, cloud computing, parallel file and storage systems, deep learning and data analytics. Dr. Yu has graduated many doctoral and master students who upon graduation joined prestigious organizations such as Boeing, Yahoo, Intel, IBM, Amazon, Oak Ridge National Lab, Berkeley Lab, Argonne Lab, Arista Networks, and other industry positions. Yu's research has been supported for nearly $8 million by many federal and commercial sponsors including NASA, NSF, DOE (ORNL and LLNL), Alabama Department of Commerce, Mellanox, Intel, NVIDIA, and Scitor, with Yu serving as the PI for more than $6 million. His research also has been supported through equipment donations from Mellanox, NVIDIA, and Solarflare. Yu is a senior member of IEEE and member of AAAS, ACM and USENIX. Teaching Spring 2021: COP 5611 - Advanced Operating Systems Fall 2022: CIS 5930 - Systems Research on Data Analytics and Deep Learning Archived Courses Prospective Students Joining CASTL: I would be very honored to team with students with strong motivation, positive spirit, and unwavering diligence, because the journey to a successful doctoral disseration requires immensive efforts from both the student and the advisor. If you are passionate about joining my lab for your PhD degree, please feel free to send me an individual message with this subject line: University: XYZ, GPA: 3.XY, GRE V/Q: 15X/16Y. Reference scores: For students interested in pursuing a doctoral degree in the CASTL lab, please refer to the average scores from current PhD students in the lab. 2015-2017: GRE-V: 155; GRE-Q: 165; TOEFL: 102; Undergraduate GPA: 3.67. How to Have a Bad Career in Research. How to Write a Good Systems Paper and How to Get Your Sysetms Paper Accepted. Recent Grants National Science Foundation: Cluster 2024 Student Travel Support. National Science Foundation: Collaborative Research: OAC Core: CropDL - Scheduling and Checkpoint/Restart Support for Deep Learning Applications on HPC Clusters. National Science Foundation: MobilityNet: A Trustworthy CI Emulation Tool for Cross-Domain Mobility Data Generation and Sharing towards Multidisciplinary Innovations. University Services Chair - Department of Computer Science, 2023-2026. Associate Chair for Research - Department of Computer Science, 2022-2023. Trainee - FSU Emerging Leadership Program, 2020-2021. Member - FSU Research Infrastructure and Technology Taskforce (RITT), 2020-present. Member - FSU Research Computing Advisory Council, 2020-present. Chair - CS Faculty Search Committee, 2018-2020. Member - FSU Center for Genomics and Personalized Medicine (CGPM) Executive Committee, 2018-2019. Member - CS Chair Selection Committee, 2016-2017. Member - CS Graduate Admission Committee, 2015-2017. External Services Editorial Excellence Award (2020) - IEEE TPDS editorial board Associate Editor for TPDS (2018-2022) Steering Committee Member: IEEE Cluster, 2024- Steering Committee Member: Extreme-Scale Storage and Analysis Workshop, 2020-present Supercomputing (SC) (2010, 2024) Doctoral Showcase, (2013, 2017, 2021), TPC member INFOCOM (2018, 2019, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025), TPC member PPoPP (2025), TPC member HPDC (2022, 2023, 2024), TPC member ICDCS (2021, 2025), TPC member IPDPS (2020, 2021, 2022), TPC member Cluster (2012, 2015, 2018, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023), TPC member CCGrid (2013, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2020, 2021, 2022) TPC member IEEE BigData (2013, 2014, 2015, 2017, 2018), TPC member HPCC 2017, TPC member ICPP (2007, 2008), TPC member PC Vice Chair: NAS 2015 Network Track. PC Co-Chair: DISCS 2015, 2014 International Workshop on Data-Intensive Scalable Computing Systems (DISCS-2014). Co-Chair: Dagstuhl Workshop on Challenges and Opportunities of User-Level File Systems for HPC, 2015. Panelist: NASA 2017, NIH 2014, NSF (2020, 2019, 2018, 2015, 2014, 2013, 2012, 2011, 2010), DOE ASCR (2023, 2011), NIST BTOP 2009. External Proposal Reviewer: Hong Kong RGC (2014), Canada NSERC (2014) Technical Reviewers for major journals such as TCBB, TPDS, TC, JPDC, IEEE Micro, IEEE Computer, PLOS One, etc. Last Modified: August 3, 2023
